title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Gotta Catch ’Em All (2/6)
text:
Reading in data regarding Pokemon.

pokemon <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-04-01/pokemon_df.csv')

Rows: 949 Columns: 22
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (10): pokemon, type_1, type_2, color_1, color_2, color_f, egg_group_1, e...
dbl (12): id, species_id, height, weight, base_experience, hp, attack, defen...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(pokemon, aes(x = weight, y = defense)) +
  geom_point()







# data where a pokemon appears for each type it is
pokemon_long <- pokemon |> pivot_longer(
  names_to = NULL,
  cols = starts_with("type_"),
  values_to = "type",
  values_drop_na = TRUE
)

pokemon_long <- pokemon_long |> pivot_longer(
  names_to = NULL,
  cols = starts_with("egg_group_"),
  values_to = "egg_group",
  values_drop_na = TRUE
)

pokemon_type <- pokemon_long |> group_by(type, egg_group) |> summarise(n_pokemon = n())

`summarise()` has grouped output by 'type'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.

pokemon_type <- pokemon_type |> unite("type_egg", type:egg_group)

pokemon_type <- pokemon_type |> arrange(desc(n_pokemon)) |> slice(1:10) |> mutate(type_egg = fct_reorder(type_egg, n_pokemon))


ggplot(pokemon_type, aes(x = type_egg, y = n_pokemon)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity")









pokemon_plot <- pokemon_long |> group_by(type) |> mutate(median = median(defense)) |> ungroup() |> mutate(type = fct_reorder(type, median))

ggplot(pokemon_plot, aes(x = type, y = defense)) +
  geom_boxplot(fill = "pink", color = "hotpink3") + 
  theme_linedraw()







bug <- pokemon_long |> filter(type == "bug")
